hcm.ssj.core

Class Pipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • hcm.ssj.core.Pipeline

  • public class Pipeline
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for creating and interfacing with SSJ pipelines. Holds logic responsible for the setup and execution of pipelines.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Pipeline getInstance()
        Retrieve the SSJ pipeline instance. Only one SSJ pipeline instance per application is supported, yet it can contain multiple parallel branches.
        Returns:
        Pipeline the pipeline instance

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the SSJ pipeline. Automatically resets buffers and component states.

      • addSensor

        public SensorChannel addSensor(Sensor s,
                               SensorChannel c)
                        throws SSJException
        Adds a sensor with a corresponding channel to the pipeline and sets up the necessary output buffer. Calls init method of sensor and channel before setting up buffer.
        Parameters:
        s - the Sensor to be added
        c - the corresponding channel
        Returns:
        the same SensorChannel which was passed as parameter
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the sensor

      • addTransformer

        public Provider addTransformer(Transformer t,
                               Provider source,
                               double frame,
                               double delta)
                        throws SSJException
        Adds a transformer to the pipeline and sets up the necessary output buffer. init method of transformer is called before setting up buffer.
        Parameters:
        t - the Transformer to be added
        source - the component which will provide data to the transformer
        frame - the size of the data window which is provided every iteration to the transformer (in seconds)
        delta - the amount of input data which overlaps with the previous window (in seconds). Provided in addition to the primary window ("frame").
        Returns:
        the Transformer which was passed as parameter
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • addTransformer

        public Provider addTransformer(Transformer t,
                               Provider[] sources,
                               double frame,
                               double delta)
                        throws SSJException
        Adds a transformer to the pipeline and sets up the necessary output buffer. init method of transformer is called before setting up buffer.
        Parameters:
        t - the Transformer to be added
        sources - the components which will provide data to the transformer
        frame - the size of the data window which is provided every iteration to the transformer (in seconds)
        delta - the amount of input data which overlaps with the previous window (in seconds). Provided in addition to the primary window ("frame").
        Returns:
        the Transformer which was passed as parameter
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer(Consumer c,
                        Provider source,
                        double frame,
                        double delta)
                 throws SSJException
        Adds a consumer to the pipeline. init method of consumer is called after setting up internal input buffer.
        Parameters:
        c - the Consumer to be added
        source - the component which will provide data to the consumer
        frame - the size of the data window which is provided every iteration to the transformer (in seconds)
        delta - the amount of input data which overlaps with the previous window (in seconds). Provided in addition to the primary window ("frame").
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer(Consumer c,
                        Provider[] sources,
                        double frame,
                        double delta)
                 throws SSJException
        Adds a consumer to the pipeline. init method of consumer is called after setting up internal input buffer.
        Parameters:
        c - the Consumer to be added
        sources - the components which will provide data to the consumer
        frame - the size of the data window which is provided every iteration to the transformer (in seconds)
        delta - the amount of input data which overlaps with the previous window (in seconds). Provided in addition to the primary window ("frame").
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer(Consumer c,
                        Provider source,
                        EventChannel channel)
                 throws SSJException
        Adds a consumer to the pipeline. init method of consumer is called after setting up internal input buffer.
        Parameters:
        c - the Consumer to be added
        source - the component which will provide data to the consumer
        channel - an event channel which acts as a trigger. The consumer will only process data when an event is received. The data window to be processed is defined by the timing information of the event.
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer(Consumer c,
                        Provider source,
                        EventChannel[] channels)
                 throws SSJException
        Adds a consumer to the pipeline. init method of consumer is called after setting up internal input buffer.
        Parameters:
        c - the Consumer to be added
        source - the component which will provide data to the consumer
        channels - the event channels which act as a trigger. The consumer will only process data when an event is received. The data window to be processed is defined by the timing information of the event.
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer(Consumer c,
                        Provider[] sources,
                        EventChannel channel)
                 throws SSJException
        Adds a consumer to the pipeline. init method of consumer is called after setting up internal input buffer.
        Parameters:
        c - the Consumer to be added
        sources - the components which will provide data to the consumer
        channel - an event channel which acts as a trigger. The consumer will only process data when an event is received. The data window to be processed is defined by the timing information of the event.
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer(Consumer c,
                        Provider[] sources,
                        EventChannel[] channels)
                 throws SSJException
        Adds a consumer to the pipeline. init method of consumer is called after setting up internal input buffer.
        Parameters:
        c - the Consumer to be added
        sources - the components which will provide data to the consumer
        channels - the event channels which act as a trigger. The consumer will only process data when an event is received. The data window to be processed is defined by the timing information of the event.
        Throws:
        SSJException - thrown is an error occurred when setting up the component

      • registerEventListener

        public void registerEventListener(Component c,
                                  Component source)
        Registers a component as a listener to another component's events. Component is also added to the pipeline (if not already there) This component will be notified every time the "source" component pushes an event into its channel
        Parameters:
        c - the listener
        source - the one being listened to

      • registerEventListener

        public void registerEventListener(Component c,
                                  EventChannel channel)
        Registers a component as a listener to a specific event channel. Component is also added to the pipeline (if not already there) This component will be notified every time a new event is pushed into the channel.
        Parameters:
        c - the listener
        channel - the channel to be listened to

      • registerEventListener

        public void registerEventListener(Component c,
                                  EventChannel[] channels)
        Register a component as a listener to multiple event channels. Component is also added to the pipeline (if not already there) This component will be notified every time a new event is pushed a channel.
        Parameters:
        c - the listener
        channels - the channel to be listened to

      • registerEventProvider

        public EventChannel registerEventProvider(Component c)
        Register a component as an event provider. Component is also added to the pipeline (if not already there)
        Parameters:
        c - the event provider
        Returns:
        the output channel of the component.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the pipeline. Closes all buffers and shuts down all components. Also writes log file to sd card (if configured).

      • release

        public void release()
        Invalidates framework instance and clears all local content

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all buffers, components and internal pipeline state, but does not invalidate instance.

      • executeRunnable

        public void executeRunnable(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Executes a runnable using the pipeline's thread pool

      • resetCreateTime

        public void resetCreateTime()
        Resets pipeline "create" timestamp

      • getTime

        public double getTime()
        Returns:
        elapsed time since start of the pipeline (in seconds)

      • getTimeMs

        public long getTimeMs()
        Returns:
        elapsed time since start of the pipeline (in milliseconds)

      • getStartTimeMs

        public long getStartTimeMs()
        Returns:
        system time at which the pipeline started

      • getCreateTimeMs

        public long getCreateTimeMs()
        Returns:
        system time at which the pipeline instance was created. Timestamp can be modified using "resetCreateTime()"

      • isInstanced

        public static boolean isInstanced()
        Returns:
        true if SSJ has already been instanced, false otherwise

      • getState

        public Pipeline.State getState()
        Returns:
        current state of the framework

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns:
        true if pipeline is running, false otherwise

      • isStopping

        public boolean isStopping()
        Returns:
        true if pipeline shut down has been initiated, false otherwise

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns:
        current SSJ version

      • setExceptionHandler

        public void setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler h)
        Sets a handler for SSJ errors and crashes. The handler is notified every time an SSJException happens at runtime.
        Parameters:
        h - a class which implements the ExceptionHandler interface
